alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 12:45PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Bonner, northwestern Benewah, western Kootenai, northeastern Whitman, southeastern Stevens, eastern Spokane and southeastern Pend Oreille Counties through 115 PM PDT... At 1244 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Deer Park to 17 miles west of Plummer. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Spokane, Spokane Valley, Coeur d`Alene, Post Falls, Hayden, Rathdrum, Dalton Gardens, Liberty Lake, Deer Park, Newport, Spirit Lake, Millwood, Plummer, Hauser, Harrison, Otis Orchards-East Farms, Fairwood, Otis Orchards, Dishman, and Parkline. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 280 and 299. Interstate 90 in Idaho between mile markers 0 and 14. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 392 and 435. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 0 and 4. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 287 and 334. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 85 and 95. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 165 and 190. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
